Specimen Type: Clinical specimens such as blood, urine, respiratory samples, swabs, and tissue biopsies
Purpose: Isolation and identification of Candida species to aid in the diagnosis of candidiasis and guide antifungal therapy
Container: Sterile, leak-proof container appropriate to specimen type (e.g., blood culture bottle, sterile urine cup, swab transport tube)
Equipment: Incubator (35–37 °C), culture media (blood agar, SDA, chromogenic agar), biochemical identification system (API 20C AUX or Vitek 2 YST), MALDI-TOF MS, centrifuge
